TopicTitle: Have you ever thought you did REALLY bad on a test?

Articles.Content:
But then it turns out you did amazing/decent?

I thought I had a 40-50% on my second Calculus test.

I got an 80.3%

So basically, I could get a 40% on my final test (in two days) and still get away with a B/B- for the whole course.

I are a happy person.
The opposite is true in my case.

The opposite is true in my case.

Same here, I thought I did decent on my Spanish II exam last year turned out I got 56% and flunked the course :\'(

Way back in school I once walked happily out of a german test thinking I got a (near) perfect score. Instead I got a 0. I\'d completely misunderstood the whole text and basically made up my own story and answered the quiz based on that. Oh school.

Most of the time i think i did horrible

and im right...

Lol

On my first Calc test I thought I did really good, but instead came out with a 79% (which was curved up to an 84.2%, HUGE curve in my opinion).

And yes, there have been many cases where I thought I did well and ended up truly sucking
